context.text: Black Reel Awards - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
[ edit ] Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture
[ edit ] Best Actor in a Motion Picture
[ edit ] Best Actor in a Motion Picture
[ edit ] Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture

Motion Pictures Film Actress Actor Supporting Actor Supporting Actress Best Breakthrough Performance Best Director Best Screenplay, Adapted or Original Best Ensemble Best Film Poster Best Original Song Best Original Soundtrack Best Score
Here's are the different ceremonies with winners and nominees:

1 Award Summaries 2 Categories 2.1 Best Actor in a Motion Picture 2.2 Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture 2.3 Best Director 2.4 Best Song (Adapted or Original) 2.5 Best Breakthrough Performance 2.6 Best Motion Picture 2.7 2007 Winners 2.8 2006 Winners 2.9 Films Nominations/Wins 2.10 Multiple Nominees/Winners Chart 2.11 External links

The FAAAF/Black Reel Awards benefit The Foundation for the Advancement of African Americans in Film (FAAAF), a non-profit arts organization whose mission is to provide educational opportunities to future minority film executives. Through the FAAAF programs "Reel Kids," and "Producer's Institute," scholarships are awarded to minority junior high, high school and college graduate students pursuing careers in the movie and television industries.

The Black Reel Awards began in 2000 and were designed to annually recognize and celebrate the achievements of black people in feature, independent and television films. Awards range from the art of character portrayals to the artistry displayed behind the camera.
